grants.recipientLocation: West Dunbartonshire Scotland
grants.title: Dumbarton District Disabled Children's Forum
grants.description: This grant will benefit 80 young people with physical disabilities, sensory impairment or behavioural difficulties. The grant will be used to purchase a fully adapted caravan that will enable the young people to experience a greater level of independence whilst on holiday. Most of the young people who will be offered the holidays live in circumstances where poverty, social deprivation or their level of disability would preclude them from accessing a holiday.

grants.title: We are the gate keepers lets make informed decisions
grants.recipientLocation: Manchester District Ardwick Ward North West
grants.description: The funding will be used to run a volunteer-led outreach programme, including fortnightly meetings and one to one and group support sessions for black and minority ethnic (BME) families of children with autism. The project aims to address the stigma around disability and increase access to support.

grants.recipientLocation: Selby District Yorkshire and the Humber
grants.title: Music on Wheels
grants.description: This group will use funding to provide weekly activity workshops for disabled children and their able-bodied peers, including singing and playing instruments. This will improve confidence, self esteem and also be therapeutic for children taking part, while also improving understanding between these two groups.

grants.title: A Dynamic Future
grants.recipientLocation: Wrecsam - Wrexham Erddig ED Wales
grants.description: 270 young disabled people aged 14 - 25 living in Wrexham will be assisted to design and implement their own individual transition plan enabling them to achieve their goals and make informed decisions about their future. Support networks will be developed and there will be opportunities to work with colleges and statutory and third sector organisations. The project will include the establishment of a youth forum, social activities and basic skills training in readiness for employment and independent living.

grants.title: Y BONT 'Making our mark' (publicity & marketing)
grants.recipientLocation: Pen-y-bont ar Ogwr - Bridgend Oldcastle ED Wales
grants.description: Bridgend & District Resource for Children with Disabilities will revise their marketing materials in order to update and refresh their current outdated and worn imagery. This project meets the Awards for All aim of extending access and participation. The grant for £4,446 will fund designing and rebranding of materials, build, hosting and updating a website, signage, pop-up displays and outdoor banners, marketing materials and translation costs.

grants.title: Reaching Out to Isolated Communities
grants.description: A new project, based on a 12 month pilot to reduce the risk of isolation and improve the wellbeing of families caring for a disabled child, particularly from ethnic minority communities, throughout the West Midlands. Newlife Foundation for Disabled Children (NFDC). Based in Cannock, Staffordshire, it will work in partnership with the charity Include Me Too to provide information and support services to increase confidence and self esteem for families caring for a disabled child in hard to reach communities.

grants.description: The project, based on the Pembrokeshire coast, will provide a purpose-built holiday facility for children diagnosed with autism or learning difficulties, their families and carers, which can be used all year round. The funding, over one year, will be used to purchase, renovate and equip a bungalow to the National Autistic Society's standards.
